ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: Because this work would have not been possible without her help, making the our journeys always easy and enjoyable, we are warmly grateful to Maria Miranda. We thank all the personnel working at the Museo Civico di Zoologia (Rome, Italy), MUSE (Trento, Italy), Naturhistorisches Museum Wien (Vienna, Austria), Museum für Naturkunde (Berlin, Germany), Zoologische Staatssammlung München (Munich, Germany), American Museum of Natural History (New York, USA) and The Field Museum of Natural History (Chicago, USA) who warmly welcomed and helped us during this study. In particular, we thank H.-M. Berg, M.C. Deflorian, P. Eckhoff, F. Fraticelli, S. Frahnert A. Gamauf, L. Garetano, M. Hennen, C. Marangoni and M. Unsöld. We also thank S. Birks from Burke Museum of Natural History and Culture, Seattle, USA, for providing further sample material for genetic analysis. Special thanks to G. Bombieri, C. Camacho, G. Orizaola, J. Martinez Padilla, V. Penteriani and J. Mayor Resano for comments on earlier drafts, G. Bombieri for the drawings in figures and P. Laiolo for her assisstance with phylogenetic analyses. The work was financially supported by the (a) British Ecological Society (#5710 / 6754); (b) Spanish Ministry of Sciences, Innovation and Universities (#CGL2016-79764-P); and (c) a Spanish Ramon y Cajal grant RYC-2014-16263 (MMD). Molecular phylogenetic analyses were supported by DFG (PA1818/3-1).
